channel.title: Compile Error

item.title: Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @Elven_Dremor Elven Dremor
item.description:
@Elven_Dremor wrote:

[code] if (command.equals(“teleall”) && playerRights >= 3) {
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { // loop so it effects all players
if (p != null) { // weeds out the nulls from our function
client castOn = (client) p; // specific player’s client

                castOn.toX = absX;
                castOn.toY = absY;
            }
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:9, topic:265276”]Also, here’s a tip for other some ‘100 errors’:

[EXAMPLE]

^ client.java:1000: illegal start of type

That ^ means the error is above line 1000 (in my example; it will be different for you.)[/quote]

thanks, no mod

thanks guys

Read full topic

item.title: Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:9, topic:265276”]Also, here’s a tip for other 100 errors:

[EXAMPLE]

^ client.java:1000: illegal start of type

That ^ means the error is above line 1000 (in my example; it will be different for you.)[/quote]
Oh wow. Didn’t know that. Thanks, you helped me too.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Also, here’s a tip for other some ‘100 errors’:

[EXAMPLE]

^ client.java:1000: illegal start of type

That ^ means the error is above line 1000 (in my example; it will be different for you.)

And a tip for writing ‘if’ statements:

You only need to close it once, like so

if (myIfStatement) { //If statement //Do stuff } //Closes the if statement

So something like this would not work

if (myIfStatement) { //If statement //Do stuff } //Closes the if statement } //Will cause 100 errors, because you closed the if-statement more times than needed.

But something like this will work

if (myIfStatement) { //If statement if (myOtherIfStatement) { //Second if-statement //Do stuff } //Closes the if statement } //Will not cause errors, because there is two if-statements.

And with if-else statements, you’ll need to close those too, like so

if (myIfStatement) { //Does stuff } else { //Does something else }

I hope I helped.

-I bet all of this is 100% wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile Error
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Do what qwerty said. For every opening bracket { you only need one closing bracket }.
